00004 /*
00005  * Zoom-pan-rotate mouse manipulation module for GLUT
00006  * Version 0.4, October 2003
00007  *
00008  * Nigel Stewart
00009  * School of Computer Science and Information Technology
00010  * RMIT University
00011  * nigels@cs.rmit.edu.au
00012  *
00013  * Instructions
00014  * ------------
00015  *
00016  * Call zprInit() immediately after your call to glutCreateWindow()
00017  *
00018  * The ZPR module handles glutReshapeFunc(), glutMouseFunc() and glutMotionFunc()
00019  * Applications should not bypass the ZPR handlers for reshape or mouse events.
00020  *
00021  * Mouse manipulation of the GLUT window via the modelview matrix:
00022  *
00023  * Left   button -> rotate
00024  * Middle button -> zoom
00025  * Right  button -> pan
00026  *
00027  * Picking is also provided via two configurable callbacks:
00028  *
00029  * void zprSelectionFunc(void (*f)(void))
00030  *
00031  *   The draw function to be called in OpenGL selection
00032  *   mode in response to a mouse-down button event.
00033  *
00034  *
00035  * Limitations
00036  * -----------
00037  *
00038  * Works best with zprReferencePoint appropriately configured.
00039  * Works best with ortho projection.
00040  * You may need to use glEnable(GL_NORMALIZATION) for correct lighting.
00041  * Near and far clip planes are hard-coded.
00042  * Zooming and rotation is centered on the origin.
00043  * Only one window can use the callbacks at one time.
00044  *
00045  */
00046

00051 void zprInit();
